headline: State Board of Education expected to approve new commissioner today
sentences:
Hot topics
Math textbooks: The Florida Department of Education continued to provide little information about why it rejected certain math books, or put some back on the approved list after initial rejection.
From the court docket ... An Orange County family is suing the school district, contending it delayed reporting an assault of a kindergarten student, the Orlando Sentinel reports.
HB 1557: Some Florida teachers are calling the states new law that restricts instruction on gender identity and sexual orientation hurtful and insulting,? the Guardian reports.
Masks: A Palm Beach County teacher who was found guilty of trespassing after coming to school without a mask last October will return to his job, the Palm Beach Post reports.
State Board of Education members, all of whom were appointed by DeSantis, are expected to give their blessing when they meet this morning to consider the appointment.
Bullying: A Miami-Dade County parent said his daughters charter school has done nothing to stop bullying by students despite numerous complaints, WFOR reports.
State Sen. Manny Diaz Jr., a Hialeah Republican with a long history supporting school choice, charter schools and other planks of his partys agenda, is Gov.
Hes got plenty of controversial issues to tackle in the office, all during a time when education is elevated in the public eye as elections approach.
Every Thursday, get the latest updates on whats happening in Tampa Bay area schools from Times education reporter Jeffrey S. Solochek.
On its website it offered a comment, without evidence, that publishers were removing woke content? to get approval.
We've asked @EducationFL for specific details about why it moved math books from its rejected to approved list.

Social-emotional learning: Gov.

Other school news
The University of South Florida St. Petersburg campus needs a new regional chancellor.
A Duval County elementary school shut down its cafeteria because of a rodent infestation, WJXT reports.
The cafeteria workers at a Palm Beach County middle school are building relationships with students.
The School Board is discussing ways to bring affordable housing to the area, Keys Weekly reports.
The Lunch Lady Squad is using TikTok videos to create a culture of kindness, WPTV reports.
This live performance by Silk Sonic from the recent Grammy Awards is too good to pass up.
Read all about Diaz before you watch the board meeting at 11 a.m. on The Florida Channel.
No search has been conducted, and no other names have been put forward for consideration.
The big story: Florida is poised to get a new point man on public education policy.
Monroe County school district employees cant easily afford to live where they work.
Ron DeSantis has turned the concept into a target for conservatives, NPR reports.
If approved, will Diaz become a political lightning rod like his predecessor?
Ron DeSantis choice to become the states next education commissioner.
